It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1827 Nov. 6 [to] Major W[illia]m Crisp, Nashville, Tennessee / Jas Royall
bibl.author: Royall, Jas
bibl.note: This document is a letter dated November 6th, 1827 to Major William Crisp from Jas Royall regarding a journal manuscript that Royall is waiting to be printed.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: You will please make inquiry at the office of the Whig & Banner whether they have received a manuscript Journal of the Tennessee Caravan to Santafee & if so the reason that it is not printed as I had a right to expect from the editors leter to me if he does not design it you please call for it & forward the manuscript by the earliest oportunity to Memphis: I have no interesting intelligence from our quarter more than have possibly heard Miller & Phoebus report says met in Bolivar & the interposition of friends prevented serious consequences: public opinion appears to have received additional force in opposition to the advocate growing out of the opposition they have manifested since the election as well as someone other reasons which are considered liberal & personal. I been recently warmly solicited to commence the publication of the star in opposition with the promise of nearly universal patronage: but my private circumstances has hitherto prevented its appearance will possibly doo so untill spring:

closer.salute: I am dear sir with sentiments of esteem yours &c
